easy to eat at the popular spots if you go early.  the "pepito" are thin crisp bread sandwiches.  had the salmon one which was delicious.  5 dishes for 2 was good.  gambas al ajillo -- shrimps here were tiny, but they have the excellent oil, garlic flavors down.  pulpo mojo picon with grilled octopus, mashed potatoes, julienned snap pea pods, and cilantro sauce.  they are heavy on cilantro and chimichurri type sauces.  scallops with bolognese sauce and arugula/mushroom, seabass cured with spinach, orange, pine puts, green sauce, micro chives on everything, such tasty savory combos, but also heavier on salt like most places.  easy to bring kids here.
